name: Sir Coxson Downbeat t shirt Navy Blue L/S
description:
Clement Seymour, Sir Coxsone, Downbeat The Ruler, Dodd..the KiNG of sounds and blues and Jamaica’s most celebrated producer left a musical legacy that stretches far and wide..from the streets, hills and gullies of Jamaica across the sea to London, New York, Tokyo, Paris, Berlin, Rio and beyond.

Instrumental in the development of Jamaica’s independent music industry from shuffle through to Ska, Rocksteady, and onto Reggae Sir Coxsone’s legendary Jamaica recording and Publishing Studio aka Studio 1 reigned supreme throughout the 1960’s and 1970’s but it was built on the success of his Sound System Sir Coxsons Downbeat which was widely regarded as the Number 1 Sound on the Island due not only to his choice of selectors and sounds but also his desire to be the best and write his page in history.

Vocalists, instrumentalists and groups such as the Wailers, the Maytals, Ken Boothe, Jackie Mittoo, Don Drummond, Roland Alphonso, Dennis Brown, Delroy Wilson, the Heptones, Burning Spear, Horace Andy, Lee Perry, the Skatalites and MANY, MANY more forged their careers at Brentford Road and went on to record some of the greatest and most authentic Soul Rebel music of the 1960’s and 70’s. Without Coxsone this wouldn’t have been possible.

The Sir Coxson Downbeat tribute t shirt launched the bloodsweatandtees project way back in 2007 and is now available in LIMITED EDITION print runs in 9 colours as a Long Sleeve and Short Sleeve in 5 Sizes. Screen Printed in England on 100% semi combed Cotton, tubular construction, premium, t Shirts using water based, non toxic ink and sustainable production methods. An ORIGiNAL, INDEPENDENT bloodsweatandteeS Artwork. Often copied NEVER bettered.

name: A Bout De Souffle (BELMoNDo) t shirt White
description:
in 1960 Jean Luc Godard directed his first feature film A Bout De Souffle, (aka Breathless), featuring mod/ern/ist icons Jean Paul Belmondo and Jean Seberg. Not only was it one of the most stylish movies of the period it was also a film that genuinely broke the rules and in doing so changed the face of movies forever. Shot reportage style on the streets of Paris in 1959 and cited as an inspiration by cats such as Martin Scorsese, Quentin Tarantino, Ken Loach, Wim Wenders, John Woo, Bernado Bertolucci, Jim Jarmusch, Werner Fassbinder and Pier Paolo Pasolini, Breathless stands tall as one of the truly great films and Michel, (Belmondo), one if its top ranking SoulrebelS
the A Bout De Soufle, t Shirt is produced, (as are all the bloodsweatandtees releases), in TRIBUTE to the singers, producers, players, writers, songs, books, films, knowledgehustlers and Soulrebel heroes that continue to have a MAJOR influence on the narrative of 'the Outsider'
LIMITED EDITION print runs available in 2 colours and 5 Sizes Screen Printed in England on 100% semi combed Cotton, tubular construction, premium, t Shirts using water based, non toxic ink and sustainable production methods. An ORIGiNAL and INDEPENDENT bloodsweatandteeS Artwork. often copied NEVER bettered.

name: Sam Cooke Mr SoUL Sweat Shirt
description:
"All I ever wanted to be was Sam Cooke" - Otis Redding
Introducing the BloodSweatandTees Sam Cooke (Mr SouL) Limited Edition Sweat Shirt. Independently Produced. Designed and Screen Printed using Water Based Ink here in England on a TOP Quality, Heavyweight, 100% Cotton Sweat Shirt. A Garment of Distinction.
Sam Cooke (aka Mr Soul) was instrumental in developing the sound now known as Soul, blending Gospel with Rhythm and Blues to craft a new style of Urbanmusicology. From his first recordings with the Soul Stirrers, (Jesus Gave Me Water/Peace In The Valley), for Art Rupe's Speciality label in 1951, onto BIG hits such as You Send Me and Only Sixteen, Sam Cooke knew exactly what he was doing.
Taking more creative control at the birth of Soul in 1960 with cuts such as Chain Gang, Feel it, Cupid and Bring It On Home To Me through to his final recording session leaving us with one of the great tunes, A Change Is Gonna Come...Sam Cooke was a vanguard and pioneer who paved the way for artists such as Jerry Butler, Curtis Mayfield, Otis Redding, Solomon Burke, Bobby Womack, Marvin Gaye and Al Green.
the Sam Cooke (Mr SouL) Limited Edition Sweat Shirt is Available in 1 colour and 5 Sizes. Screen Printed in England on (100% Cotton Body 82% Cotton/18% Poly RiB) a Premium, Heavyweight, Soundboy BURiAL Sweatshirt using water based, non toxic ink and sustainable, local, production methods to deliver a Garment of distinction. An ORIGiNAL bloodsweatandteeS artwork ... often copied NEVER bettered

name: Tuff Scout t shirt London Red
description:
Tuff Scout is an Independent London label recording, releasing and distributing prime slices of 21st Century roots Reggae. It’s principle architect has lived and breathed Jamaica’s greatest export since the mid 70’s when it ignited on the streets of London to speak to a whole generation of disenfranchised youth who connected to it’s message of positivity and freedom combined with revolution and overt anti establishment attitude.
Reggae is music made by the people for the people with little or no regard for commercialism and Tuff Scout carries on the tradition of recording and releasing conscious music for the Soulrebel community. Artists such as Big Youth, Papa Levi, Robert Lee, Al Campbell, Sowell Radics, Horace Martin and Eccleton Jarrett have all featured along the way and helped to make Tuff Scout not only London’s #1 roots label but also one of my own personal favourites.

An ORiGiNAL bloodsweatandtees and Tuff Scout production.

name: iNNER CiTY BLUeS t shirt White
description:
as the 1960's drew to a close revealing urban poverty, government corruption, war and social disparity, poets such as Curtis Mayfield, Bob Dylan, Sam Cooke, Bob Marley, Gil Scott Heron, Fela Kuti, Burning Spear and others were carrying on the tradition of using song to protest against injustice and the plight of the sufferer. Into the fray stepped Marvin Gaye to record one of the greatest LP's of the age. As early as 1965 Marvin had asked himself :
"With the world exploding around me, how am I supposed to keep singing love songs?"
and 5 years later the seminal 'What's Going On' LP was recorded and released. Inner City Blues is STILL one of the most authentic critiques of the (increasing) problems faced by the sufferer in the urban jungle.
the Inner City Blues t shirt is Available in 3 colours, Long Sleeve and Short Sleeve and 5 Sizes, Screen Printed in England on 100% semi combed Cotton, tubular construction, premium t Shirts using water based, non toxic ink and sustainable, local, production methods. name: King Tubby’s HiFi t shirt JA GREEN
description:
In the Dub Arena one figure stands above all others…Osbourne Ruddock aka 'KiNG TuBBY'... Sound engineer, Sonic scientist and Dub Champion. Originally an electronic repairman he was highly regarded when it came to fixing weather beaten or sabotaged Amplifiers and equipment for Jamaica's MANY Sound Systems in the late 1950's. He Progressed to building custom Amps for them throughout the 1960's until finally building his own 'Tubby's HomeTown HiFi' in 1968.

Throughout the 1970's Tubby established himself both as an engineer and then producer mixing dubs for many of Jamaica's finest musicologists such as Lee Perry, Bunny Lee, Harry Mudie, Glen Brown and Augustus Pablo who all appreciated the mans sonic genius.

The TUBBYs HoMEToWN HiFi tribute to King Tubby tShirt is designed and INDEPENDENTLY produced, (as are all the bloodsweatandtees releases), in TRIBUTE to the singers, producers, players, writers, songs, books, films, 'urban knowledgehustlers' and street-culture heroes that have had and continue to influence the narrative of 'the Outsider'. Available in 3 colours and 5 Sizes. Screen Printed in England on 100% Cotton, tubular construction, premium, unisex t Shirts using water based ink and sustainable, local, production methods. An ORIGiNAL bloodsweatandteeS production..the home of Authentic urbanKnowledge tribute tShirts ... often copied NEVER bettered

name: the HEADHUNTERs t Shirt Navy Blue
description:
Herbie Hancock and the Headhunters changed ‘the game' fusing Jazz with Funk to create a genre now known as Jazz Funk, Fusion or Space Funk. Of course there were other inflential Cats but the 1973 Headhunters LP, (Played HEAVILY at the home of themusicologist throughout the 70's, along with LP's by cats such as Curtis Mayfield, Bobby Womack, Bill Withers, the Heptones, the Wailers, Dillinger,the Doors, Ian Dury and Stephen Stills), was a catalyst. I was 4/5 years old when it was introduced in our house on release and it blew my tiny mind.
The cover alone with its central image a combination of a reel to reel tape head demagnetiser and an African mask, it's presence called upon in times of danger during epidemics or at funeral ceremonies, was an inspiration let alone the outstanding music recorded and the t shirt was designed and produced almost 40 years later in tribute to that LP, the music and the memory.
the HeadHunters, LIMITED EDITION print run, tShirt is Available in 3 colours and 5 Sizes, Screen Printed in England on 100% semi combed Cotton, tubular construction, premium t Shirts using water based, non toxic ink and sustainable, local, production methods. An ORIGiNAL bloodsweatandteeS Artwork. ... often copied NEVER bettered.

name: Augustus Pablo A.P Special t shirt Chicago Grey
description:
in 1969 a young teenager named Horace Swaby was standing in Herman Chin Loy's 'Aquarius' record shop in Kingston holding a Melodica and when asked by the producer whether he could play it proceeded to blow a haunting melody. Chin Loy was so impressed that he booked a recording session at Randy's (North Parade) Studio the same week and the fruit of the session Iggy Iggy was soon on the shelves of Jamaica’s record shops, shacks and stalls. Seminal cuts East of the River Nile and Java soon followed and the Far East Sound was launched. Herman Chin Loy had already released sessions using a name which he stuck with and the teenager formally known as Horace Swaby forever after became known as Augustus Pablo.
A MAJOR creative force during the 1970‘s Pablo recorded and released some of the finest Reggae of the period on his own Rockers label as well as collaborating with heavyweights such as King Tubby, Lee Perry, Dillinger, The Heptones, Horace Andy and Bob Marley before moving into producing cats such as Hugh Mundell, the trio Tetrack, Junior Delgado and Yami Bolo.
A.P Special the ORiGiNAL Augustus Pablo tribute t shirt is available in LIMITED EDITION print runs in 3 colours and 5 Sizes. Screen Printed in England on 100% semi combed Cotton, tubular construction, premium, t Shirts using water based, non toxic ink and sustainable production methods. An ORIGiNAL and INDEPENDENT bloodsweatandteeS Artwork. often copied NEVER bettered.

Herman Chin Loy had already released sessions using a name which he stuck with and the teenager formally known as Horace Swaby forever after became known as Augustus Pablo.
A MAJOR creative force during the 1970‘s Pablo recorded and released some of the finest Reggae of the period on his own Rockers label as well as collaborating with heavyweights such as King Tubby, Lee Perry, Dillinger, The Heptones, Horace Andy and Bob Marley before moving into producing cats such as Hugh Mundell, the trio Tetrack, Junior Delgado and Yami Bolo.
A.P Special the ORiGiNAL Augustus Pablo tribute t shirt is available in LIMITED EDITION print runs in 3 colours and 5 Sizes. name: A Bout De Souffle Belmondo t shirt Navy Blue
description:
in 1960 Jean Luc Godard directed his first feature film A Bout De Souffle, (aka Breathless), featuring mod/ern/ist icons Jean Paul Belmondo and Jean Seberg. Not only was it one of the most stylish movies of the period it was also a film that genuinely broke the rules and in doing so changed the face of movies forever. Shot reportage style on the streets of Paris in 1959 and cited as an inspiration by cats such as Martin Scorsese, Quentin Tarantino, Ken Loach, Wim Wenders, John Woo, Bernado Bertolucci, Jim Jarmusch, Werner Fassbinder and Pier Paolo Pasolini, Breathless stands tall as one of the truly great films and Michel, (Belmondo), one if its top ranking SoulrebelS
the A Bout De Soufle, t Shirt is produced, (as are all the bloodsweatandtees releases), in TRIBUTE to the singers, producers, players, writers, songs, books, films, knowledgehustlers and Soulrebel heroes that continue to have a MAJOR influence on the narrative of 'the Outsider'

name: Ken Boothe Mr RoCKSTEADY t shirt JA Green
description:
my #1 Jamaican vocalist Ken Boothe aka 'Mr Rocksteady' has been recording ‘burial’ tunes since first appearing on Jamaica's burgeoning music scene as a child in the late 50's. Originally part of a duo with his Denham Town neighbour and friend Stranger Cole he recorded at the birth of the Ska for legendary producer Coxsone Dodd with top ranking tunes such as Worlds Fair, Artibella, I am a Fool and Crying Over You, before effortlessy making the transition to Rocksteady with more boss cuts for Studio 1 such as I Don't Want To See You Cry, Leave Me Crying and When I Fall In Love before following up with sublime pieces of Reggae and even Dancehall.
Ken Boothe has dropped sonic bombs with producers such as Leslie Kong, Phil Pratt, Keith Hudson, Bunny Lee, Prince Jammy, Jack Ruby and Tappa Zukie, during a career that stretches over 50 years and is one of the FEW remaining foundation artists to still be touring and recording.
the Mr Rocksteady, tribute to Ken Boothe, LIMITED EDITION print run t Shirt is Available in 2 colours and 5 Sizes printed by hand in England on 100% semi combed Cotton, tubular construction, premium, t Shirts using water based, non toxic ink and sustainable, local, production methods. An ORIGiNAL bloodsweatandteeS artwork ... often copied NEVER bettered

name: Al Capone Guns Don't Argue t Shirt Chicago Grey
description:
Black print on Grey t-shirt. Hand Printed, (Water Based Ink), 100% Cotton, seamless construction, ‘Classic’ Tribute Tee.
"Al Capone...Guns Don't Argue" is known to all mods, (original) skinheads and swaggering rude boys as the opening line to Prince Busters 1967 Ska classic....
But 'Scarface' or 'the Big Fellow' has always been a figure whose deeds and exploits have held the publics fascination from his first print appearence in newspapers during the 1920's, as the inspiration behind the 1932 film 'Scarface', top billing in Buster's Ska tune and now as the inspiration behind this tee.
The first in the 'Universal Infamy' series of of tees designed and produced not to glorify Gangsters, Pirates, Revolutionists and Rebels but rather to pay tribute to characters who refused to play 'the game' by 'the' rules and instead chose to play by their own...

name: Sam Cooke Mr SoUL t shirt Army Green
description:
"All I ever wanted to be was Sam Cooke" - Otis Redding
Sam Cooke (aka Mr Soul) was instrumental in developing the sound now known as Soul, blending Gospel with Rhythm and Blues to craft a new style of Urbanmusicology. From his first recordings with the Soul Stirrers, (Jesus Gave Me Water/Peace In The Valley), for Art Rupe's Speciality label in 1951, onto BIG hits such as You Send Me and Only Sixteen, Sam Cooke knew exactly what he was doing.
Taking more creative control at the birth of Soul in 1960 with cuts such as Chain Gang, Feel it, Cupid and Bring It On Home To Me through to his final recording session leaving us with one of the great tunes, A Change Is Gonna Come...Sam Cooke was a vanguard and pioneer who paved the way for artists such as Jerry Butler, Curtis Mayfield, Otis Redding, Solomon Burke, Bobby Womack, Marvin Gaye and Al Green.
  the Sam Cooke (Mr SouL) tribute t Shirt is designed and produced in honour of the man who's songs have had and continue to have a MAJOR influence.
LIMITED EDITION print runs Available in 3 colours and 5 Sizes Screen Printed in England on 100% semi combed Cotton, tubular construction, premium, t Shirts using water based, non toxic ink and sustainable production methods. Another ORIGiNAL bloodsweatandteeS Artwork. often copied NEVER bettered.

name: Sir Coxson Downbeat The Ruler t shirt Navy
description:
Clement Seymour, Sir Coxsone, Downbeat The Ruler, Dodd..the KiNG of sounds and blues and Jamaica’s most celebrated producer left a musical legacy that stretches far and wide..from the streets, hills and gullies of Jamaica across the sea to London, New York, Tokyo, Paris, Berlin, Rio and beyond.

Instrumental in the development of Jamaica’s independent music industry from shuffle through to Ska, Rocksteady, and onto Reggae Sir Coxsone’s legendary Jamaica recording and Publishing Studio aka Studio 1 reigned supreme throughout the 1960’s and 1970’s but it was built on the success of his Sound System Sir Coxsons Downbeat which was widely regarded as the Number 1 Sound on the Island due not only to his choice of selectors and sounds but also his desire to be the best and write his page in history.

Vocalists, instrumentalists and groups such as the Wailers, the Maytals, Ken Boothe, Jackie Mittoo, Don Drummond, Roland Alphonso, Dennis Brown, Delroy Wilson, the Heptones, Burning Spear, Horace Andy, Lee Perry, the Skatalites and MANY, MANY more forged their careers at Brentford Road and went on to record some of the greatest and most authentic Soul Rebel music of the 1960’s and 70’s. Without Coxsone this wouldn’t have been possible.

The Sir Coxson Downbeat tribute t shirt launched the bloodsweatandtees project way back in 2007 and is now available in LIMITED EDITION print runs in 9 colours as a Long Sleeve and Short Sleeve in 5 Sizes. Screen Printed in England on 100% semi combed Cotton, tubular construction, premium, t Shirts using water based, non toxic ink and sustainable production methods. An ORIGiNAL, INDEPENDENT bloodsweatandteeS Artwork. Often copied NEVER bettered.

name: Mellow Dub t shirt Navy Blue
description:
the Mellow Dub t shirt was produced in tribute to the hard to find and highly collectable Dub albums released by Sir Coxsone Dodd’s Studio 1 in the early part of the 1970‘s when Dub reigned supreme over Jamaica's music industry and, of course, Studio 1 was on hand to record and release some of the finest.
The Rhythms laid down at Studio 1 during the late 1960‘s and early 1970‘s form the backbone of Jamaica’s rich musical heritage and The LP that inspired this t Shirt featured versions of some Classic Studio 1 material such as the Wailers Cry To Me, Horace Andy's Just Say Who and the Heptones marrow trembler Pretty Looks.

name: the (Wailing) Wailers t shirt London Red
description:
Initially a six piece outfit the classic Wailers line up took shape under Joe Higgs during their time at Studio 1, (1963-66), but it was in 1970 when Lee Perry produced and masterminded their return with a Soulrebel sound that the Wailers and Jamaican music began to establish itself firmly on the international music map.</br>
For 5 years, beginning in 1973 with Catch a Fire and ending in 1978 with Exodus, the Wailers played a part in my learning curve and were instrumental in opening the door to Jamaican music both for me and many of my generation, leading to the discovery of cats such as The Heptones, Burning Spear, I Roy, Big Youth and Dillinger, Alton Ellis, Ken Boothe, Dennis Brown and Gregory Issacs.</br>
the ORiGiNAL Wailing Wailers t Shirt, (first produced in 2007), is designed and INDEPENDENTLY produced, (as are all the bloodsweatandtees releases), in TRIBUTE to the singers, producers, players, writers, songs, books, films, knowledgehustlers and cultural heroes that continue to influence the narrative of 'the Outsider'</br>

name: the (Wailing) Wailers t shirt Navy Blue
description:
Initially a six piece outfit the classic Wailers line up took shape under Joe Higgs during their time at Studio 1, (1963-66), but it was in 1970 when Lee Perry produced and masterminded their return with a Soulrebel sound that the Wailers and Jamaican music began to establish itself firmly on the international music map.</br>
For 5 years, beginning in 1973 with Catch a Fire and ending in 1978 with Exodus, the Wailers played a part in my learning curve and were instrumental in opening the door to Jamaican music both for me and many of my generation, leading to the discovery of cats such as The Heptones, Burning Spear, I Roy, Big Youth and Dillinger, Alton Ellis, Ken Boothe, Dennis Brown and Gregory Issacs.</br>
the ORiGiNAL Wailing Wailers t Shirt, (first produced in 2007), is designed and INDEPENDENTLY produced, (as are all the bloodsweatandtees releases), in TRIBUTE to the singers, producers, players, writers, songs, books, films, knowledgehustlers and cultural heroes that continue to influence the narrative of 'the Outsider'
</br>
LIMITED EDITION print runs available in 5 colours and 5 Sizes. Screen Printed in England on 100% semi combed Cotton, tubular construction, premium, t Shirts using water based, non toxic, ink and sustainable, local, production methods. An ORIGiNAL bloodsweatandteeS Artwork ... often copied NEVER bettered

name: the Upsetter t Shirt Army Green
description:
"The Upsetter don't come to upset the dance people. The Upsetter really come to upset the heads of government, the politicians and all the evil forces"  </br>
</br>
The Upsetter, Little Lee, Scratch, whatever the name ONE thing is certain, Lee Perry has been at the centre of Jamaican music since the early 1960's arranging, recording and producing seminal tunes for artists such as the Wailers, the Maytals, the Skatalites, the Heptones, Earl 16, Pat Kelly, Max Romeo, Leonard Dillon, Bob Marley, Augustus Pablo and MANY more.  Always on the frontline And hugely influential in shaping the development of Jamaican music as it evolved from Ska through Rocksteady and into what became known, (much to his dislike), as Reggae. His collaborations with producers such as Joe Gibbs, Bunny Lee and King Tubby helped define the sound of young Jamaica.</br>
</br>
 For more than a decade between 1964 and 1978 the Upsetter was on fire recording, arranging, writing, producing and promoting some of the greatest, most respected and well recognised music to come out of Jamaica.</br>
</br>
the Upsetter, LIMITED EDITION print run, tribute to Lee Perry t shirt is available in 3 colours and 5 Sizes screen printed in England on 100% semi combed Cotton, tubular construction, premium, t shirts using water based, non toxic ink and low impact, sustainable production methods. An ORIGiNAL, INDEPENDENT bloodsweatandteeS Artwork. Often copied NEVER bettered.</br>
</br>

</br>

name: the iMPRESSiONS t Shirt Chicago Grey
description:
the Impressions, (Fred Cash, Sam Gooden and Curtis Mayfield), together crafted some of the GREAT Soul vocal group songs of the 1960's. Classics such as Gypsy Woman, Minstrel and Queen, It's Alright, Keep On Pushing, Talking About My Baby, I'm So Proud, Right On Time, Young Mods Forgotten Story, (the list goes on), helped define the decade and set the tone for what was to follow
the Impressions also had a profound impact on the sound of young Jamaica inspiring Cats such as Bob Marley, Peter Tosh and Bunny Livingstone, (aka the Wailers), as well as vocal groups the Techniques, the Attractions and the Sensations to help transform the Ska into the Rocksteady.
I was fortunate enough to present Sam and Fred with the t Shirt when I caught them perform in London recently and am resting easy in the knowledge that the Impressions themselves are wearing this tribute.
the Impressions tribute t Shirt is Available in LIMITED EDITION print runs in 3 colours and 5 Sizes Screen Printed in England on 100% semi combed Cotton, tubular construction, premium, t Shirts using water based, non toxic ink and sustainable production methods. An ORIGiNAL, INDEPENDENT bloodsweatandteeS Artwork. often copied NEVER bettered.
